channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH

item.title: Report E-2024110409
item.description:
Report E-2024110409

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 13, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1824 was cracked and released approximately one (1) gallon of product tot he trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew patched the damaged tote and deployed granular absorbents to remediate the sodium hydroxide-impacted trailer floor. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) lined 15-gallon drum and staged onsite.

item.title: Report E-2024110401
item.description:
Report E-2024110401

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 11, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3098 was damaged in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew deployed granular absorbents and utilized hand tools to work them in. All impacted materials and damaged cargo were collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon drums then staged onsite for further management.

item.title: Report E-2024110447
item.description:
Report E-2024110447

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: HEBRON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When driver went out to perform his pre trip at the beginning of the day he noticed liquid had dripped onto the drive tire and the pavement at 0530et. The driver put down some absorbent and then called to have a team dispatched to provide the clean up. The crew showed up around 0800et and dawned the proper PPE and made entry into the trailer. They found that a 55 gallon drum had sever rust that had damaged the integrity allowing the material to seep out. The team then removed the container and placed it into a salvage drum and then cleaned up the material that was on the floor of the trailer and that had gotten on the pavement. The absorbents were disposed of in the proper manner. The release was less than 1 gallon and the crew was complete by 1100et.

item.title: Report E-2024110345
item.description:
Report E-2024110345

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-11
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ON November 11, 2024, four (4) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed and released approximately three (3) gallons of paint to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the paint impacted site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were collected and containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110332
item.description:
Report E-2024110332

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-21T12:39:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-04
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately three (3) gallons of product released from one (1) fifty-five (55) gallon poly drum due to a forklift puncture. Personnel advised the release impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel stated that the material was cleaned up using Oil Dri absorbent. Personnel completed cleanup and generated one (1) sixty-five (65) gallon poly drum along with the damaged 55-gallon DM of product. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024110035
item.description:
Report I-2024110035

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-20T12:31:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-07
  • City: Columbus
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Customer was asked the question,"Does this bag have a battery attached, any spare batteries or e-cigarettes?" and the subsequent question,"Are all electronic devices in the bag powered off.?" when checking in his bag at the ticket counter. His answer was"No". In the bag room during TSA screening, a laptop in his bag was discovered powered on, very hot and had expanded popping the case of the laptop.

item.title: Report X-2024110621
item.description:
Report X-2024110621

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-19T12:23:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-17
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor at service center 064 contacted Safety regarding a slow leak from one of the corners of a tote containing corrosive liquid that spilled on the trailer and dock floor. The operations supervisor advised the tote did not appear to be punctured. The tote was briefly moved to the do ck, but when it continued to leak it was moved back to the trailer to contain the leak. Brandon Baumann with CURA advised the cleaning crew discovered the tote to be leaking from a defective valve.

  • Description: On November 8, 2024. one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was crushed in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized granular absorbents. hand tools, absorbent pads, and cleaning agent to remediate the site. All impacted materials were collected in one (1) 55-gallon drum, and the damaged pail was containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110122
item.description:
Report E-2024110122

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-17
  • City: MILFORD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: WORLD FUEL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7081
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/18/2024, a World Fuel Service, Inc. (WFS) transport driver when starting their shift at 04:30 called the HSE Manager to report a spill at the WFS Milford Bulk Plant. They reported there was diesel spilled throughout the facility yard and onto US HWY 50. The transport driver did know who caused it. They provided pictures and was allowed to start their shift. The HSE Manager and Milford Operations Manager went to the site to further investigate the release and its severity. After arriving to the Milford yard it was clear that someone had loaded a tank wagon and spilled product without notifying anyone. The HSE Manager and Operations Manager looked at unit 865 and it was clear the truck had an overfill and product had spilled over top of it. Th truck had fuel staining on the tanker and on the front/back of the it. HSE and Operations spoke with both night drivers and confirmed who used unit 865. When speaking with driver that used 865, they stated that they did not know about or caused any spill. The driver had started their shift at 17:30 on 10/17/2024. Footage was pulled from the truck camera system in order to determine the cause of the release. Camera footage showed the driver loading from 06:00 pm to around 06:35 pm. Camera footage showed the driver causing a spill of diesel from the truck after loading. It showed the driver pulling out of the loading bay and then back in the loading bay spilling product. Next, the driver gets out to look at the truck top, then gets back in the truck and backs out of loading bay and pulls around circling in the yard. Then, parks 10 feet away from a storm drain at the facility while product is still being released to the ground from the truck top. Next, the driver gets out and looks at the spill. During this time the driver does not take any action to stop or slow the spill nor did they report it to HSE or Operations. The driver was not following procedures and neglected to take any actions addressing the spill. Finally, the driver walks into the office building, comes back out and proceeds to leave the yard. When doing so more diesel is spilled. The majority of diesel is spilled in the facility yard. The driver turns right (west) onto US HWY 50. Product splashes off the truck onto the road way for several hundred yards. The driver finished his shift, returned to the yard and parked the truck back at the Milford Facility without reporting the release. Approximately 30 gallons of diesel fuel was spilled. HEPACO was contacted on 10/18/2024 at 04:57 and was dispatched to clean up the spill. One storm drain was impacted at the WFS facility and the diesel fuel was contained to the catch basin and recovered. Weather conditions were dry and there was no precipitation. On 10/18/2024 between 07:56 and 12:31 the NRC, Ohio EPA, Clermont Co. EMA, and Miami TWP Fire Dept. were notified of the spilled. Diesel that spilled on to US HWY 50 was not cleaned up and no roadway safety issues were reported. HEPACO finished the

item.title: Report E-2024110259
item.description:
Report E-2024110259

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-16
  • City: UHRICHSVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1242 ET, Jed Burga with XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XUR. It was reported that an unknown amount of UN3253 released from paper bags due to improper shipper loading. The release impacted Dock 3. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. A contractor was dispatched and observed eight torn bags that released approximately 1-cup of product onto the concrete dock floor, adjacent product, and plastic shrink-wrap. The concrete dock floor was impacted in a 1’x1’ area. The product was damaged due to improper loading by the Shipper. The contractor overpacked the damaged bag, containerized the floor sweepings of product and the impacted shrink-wrap. In total, five drums of waste were generated that were staged on-site for XPO to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2024110282

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 24069
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver stopped at rest stop and found trailer leaking. Leak was discovered coming from around internal valve. Contractor sent to attempt to tighten valve, but this did not work at it was found that it was coming from above that. Trailer was transloaded, and after inspection it was found to be an issue with a cracked weld in the barrel
